citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"8c3466e8-3ba3-4cc9-9f37-0755dedb003e\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 le 2018-06-28 au Endeavour North. Cette section nord des \u00e9vents hydrothermaux Endeavour comprend deux mouillages pour surveiller la circulation r\u00e9gionale. Cet instrument est un Conductivit\u00e9/Temp\u00e9rature/Profondeur. Conductivit\u00e9 Temp\u00e9rature Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abr\u00e9g\u00e9 pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivit\u00e9, la temp\u00e9rature et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinit\u00e9, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densit\u00e9 sont des variables qui peuvent \u00eatre d\u00e9riv\u00e9es des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxyg\u00e8ne, des capteurs de turbidit\u00e9 et des fluorom\u00e8tres. Il a \u00e9t\u00e9 deploy\u00e9 sur une plateforme fixe. Les donn\u00e9es de ce d\u00e9ploiement sont archiv\u00e9es et accessibles sur l\u2019infrastructure num\u00e9rique Oceans 3.0 du R\u00e9seau Canadien des Oc\u00e9ans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualit\u00e9 et produits d\u00e9riv\u00e9s selon les conventions \u00e9tablies.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Endeavour North Conductivit\u00e9/Temp\u00e9rature/Profondeur d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 2018-06-28\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/8c3466e8-3ba3-4cc9-9f37-0755dedb003e?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"8c3466e8-3ba3-4cc9-9f37-0755dedb003e\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 was deployed on 2018-06-28 at Endeavour North. This north section of the Endeavour Hydrothermal Vents includes two moorings to monitor the regional circulation. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Endeavour North Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2018-06-28\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/8c3466e8-3ba3-4cc9-9f37-0755dedb003e?local=en\"}]

          <mcc:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>The EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset is a structured dataset of Coordinate Reference Systems and Coordinate Transformations, accessible through this online registry (www.epsg-registry.org) or, as downloadable zip files, through IOGP's EPSG home page at www.epsg.org. The geographic coverage of the data is worldwide, but it is stressed that the dataset does not and cannot record all possible geodetic parameters in use around the world.</gco:CharacterString>

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 was deployed on 2018-06-28 at Endeavour North. This north section of the Endeavour Hydrothermal Vents includes two moorings to monitor the regional circulation. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">Ce Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 a été déployé le 2018-06-28 au Endeavour North. Cette section nord des évents hydrothermaux Endeavour comprend deux mouillages pour surveiller la circulation régionale. Cet instrument est un Conductivité/Température/Profondeur. Conductivité Température Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abrégé pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivité, la température et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinité, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densité sont des variables qui peuvent être dérivées des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxygène, des capteurs de turbidité et des fluoromètres. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

        <mcc:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://standards.iso.org/iso/19115/resources/Codelist/cat/codelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" codeListValue="completed"/>
      </mri:status>

      </mri:topicCategory>

      <mmi:maintenanceNote>
        <gco:CharacterString>Previous metadata record [dataset title: English = Endeavour North Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2018-06-28, dataset title: French = Endeavour North Conductivité/Température/Profondeur déployé 2018-06-28, abstract: English = The Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 was deployed on 2018-06-28 at Endeavour North. This north section of the Endeavour Hydrothermal Vents includes two moorings to monitor the regional circulation. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform.           <mac:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>The SBE 37 MicroCAT is a high accuracy conductivity and temperature recorder with an optional pressure sensor designed for deployment on moorings. The SIP model has a serial interface with an internal pump to improve conductivity response and protection against fouling.</gco:CharacterString>

name: 8c3466e8-3ba3-4cc9-9f37-0755dedb003e
notes: The Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 was deployed on 2018-06-28 at Endeavour North. This north section of the Endeavour Hydrothermal Vents includes two moorings to monitor the regional circulation. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.

notes_translated.en: The Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 was deployed on 2018-06-28 at Endeavour North. This north section of the Endeavour Hydrothermal Vents includes two moorings to monitor the regional circulation. This device is a Conductivity Temperature Depth. Conductivity Temperature Depth (CTD) is an instrument package that contains sensors for measuring the conductivity, temperature, and pressure of seawater. Salinity, sound velocity, depth and density are variables that can be derived from sensor measurements. CTDs can carry additional instruments and sensors such as oxygen sensors, turbidity sensors and fluorometers. It was deployed on a fixed platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.
notes_translated.fr: Ce Sea-Bird Microcat SBE37SIP 16435 a été déployé le 2018-06-28 au Endeavour North. Cette section nord des évents hydrothermaux Endeavour comprend deux mouillages pour surveiller la circulation régionale. Cet instrument est un Conductivité/Température/Profondeur. Conductivité Température Profondeur (CTD) est un nom abrégé pour un ensemble d'instruments qui contient des capteurs permettant de mesurer la conductivité, la température et la pression de l'eau de mer. La salinité, la vitesse du son, la profondeur et la densité sont des variables qui peuvent être dérivées des mesures par capteurs. Les CTD peuvent transporter d'autres instruments et capteurs, comme des capteurs d'oxygène, des capteurs de turbidité et des fluoromètres. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme fixe. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.

description_translated.en: The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) Pacific is the regional hub of the National CIOOS for ocean data aggregation on Canada’s west coast.
description_translated.fr: Le Système intégré d’observation des océans canadien (SIOOC) Pacifique est la plaque tournante régionale du SIOOC national pour l’agrégation des données océaniques sur la côte ouest du Canada.

title: Endeavour North Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2018-06-28

title_translated.en: Endeavour North Conductivity Temperature Depth Deployed 2018-06-28

description.fr: Accueil des données canadiennes sur l'océan Pacifique
description.en: Home of Canada's Pacific Ocean Data

resources.description: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments

description_translated.en: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments

resources.name: ERDDAP
